```{r}
library("Rcpp")
library("bench")
 
cppFunction("
  NumericVector colSums_cpp(NumericMatrix m){
 
    int nr = m.nrow();
    int nc = m.ncol();
    // col sums
    NumericVector cs(nc);
 
    // i: col index of m, j: row index of m
    // We traverse x sequentially from the first
    // to the last element, which is relatively fast.
    // Thereby, we can treat the matrix m as a vector
    // resulting from concatenating its columns.
    for(int i = 0; i < nc; i++){
      for(int j = 0; j < nr; j++){
        cs[i] += m[i*nr + j]; 
      }   
    }
 
    return cs;
 
  }
")
 
cppFunction("
  NumericVector rowSums_fast_cpp(NumericMatrix m){
 
    int nr = m.nrow();
    int nc = m.ncol();
    // row sums
    NumericVector rs(nr);
 
    // i: col index of m, j: row index of m
    // we traverse x in the same way as in colSums_cpp,
    // but sum up the corresponding element
    for(int i = 0; i < nc; i++){
      for(int j = 0; j < nr; j++){
        rs[j] += m[i*nr + j]; 
      }   
    }
 
    return rs;
 
  }
")
 
cppFunction("
  NumericVector rowSums_slow_cpp(NumericMatrix m){
 
    int nr = m.nrow();
    int nc = m.ncol();
    // row sums
    NumericVector rs(nr);
 
    // i: col index of m, j: row index of m
    for(int j = 0; j < nr; j++){ 
      for(int i = 0; i < nc; i++){
        rs[j] += m[i*nr + j]; 
      }   
    }
 
    return rs;
 
  }
")
 
m <- 200
n <- 500
set.seed(1)
mat <- matrix(rnorm(m*n), nrow = m)
 
bench::mark(
  colSums(mat),
  colSums_cpp(mat)
)
 
bench::mark(
  rowSums(mat),
  rowSums_fast_cpp(mat),
  rowSums_slow_cpp(mat)
)
```
